arts.ttl: Scotland’s win over Belarus seals top-two finish in World Cup qualifying group
arts.sum: Goals from Che Adams and Scott McTominay guaranteed Scotland at least a play-off place as Greece later suffered a 3-1 defeat against Denmark.

arts.ttl: Clarke "really disappointed" despite potentially-pivotal Scotland win over Belarus
arts.sum: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke could not hide his frustration despite the Tartan Army edging closer to a World Cup qualification playoff spot with victory over Belarus.

arts.ttl: Steve Clarke pulls no punches despite slender Scotland win: ‘Really disappointed’
arts.sum: Home wins over Greece and Belarus in the October double-header mean the Scots have 10 points from 12

arts.ttl: Shaky Scotland hold on for nervy win over Belarus
arts.sum: Watch the best of the action as goals from Che Adams and Scott McTominay earn Scotland a narrow World Cup qualifying win over Belarus.

arts.ttl: John McGinn hailed for ‘brilliant’ moment in Scotland’s victory over Belarus
arts.sum: Scotland edged ever closer to qualification for the 2026 World Cup with a narrow 2-1 victory over Belarus. Multiple Aston Villa players are currently away... The post John McGinn hailed for ‘brilliant’ moment in Scotland’s victory over Belarus appeared first on Villa News.

arts.ttl: Scotland ride luck against Belarus to take another step towards World Cup qualification
arts.sum: Scotland 2-1 Belarus: VAR came to the Scots’ rescue twice as they escaped embarrassment at the hands of the world’s 100th-ranked nation

arts.ttl: Scott McTominay and Ché Adams goals enough for nervy Scotland see off Belarus
arts.sum: Scotland edged closer to the World Cup with this result. It is just that next summer’s festival of football felt so far away as the Scots limped and laboured to victory over Belarus. A dismal showing has left Steve Clarke with far more questions than answers beforethe two closing fixtures that will determine Scotland’s Group C fate. More of this will not do; as the Hampden Park crowd pointed out with increasing ferocity during the second half. Scott McTominay eased nerves with a late goal; the Napoli man’s lack of celebration said it all. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: SCOTLAND 2 BELARUS 1: SCOTS EDGE IT IN WORLD CUP NIGHT OF DRAMA
arts.sum: SCOTLAND 2 BELARUS 1 GOALS from Che Adams and Scott McTominay made certain of victory in a tension-laden World Cup qualifying encounter against Belarus at Hampden tonight. An anxious Steve Clarke, in charge of the team for a record 72nd time, and thousands of the Tartan Army watched as the nation walked a tightrope before [...]

arts.ttl: Unconvincing Scotland beat Belarus to keep World Cup hopes alive
arts.sum: Scotland kept their World Cup qualifying hopes alive despite an unconvincing 2-1 win against pointless Belarus at an edgy Hampden Park.

arts.ttl: Scott McTominay Scotland’s hero once more as ex-Man United man seals Belarus win
